page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: The village has developed on this site from a ROMAN SETTLEMENT. Pottery and coins have been found near the stream. The name is early Saxon.{ Hendringham (the followers of Hendra). In mediaeval times there were five seperate manors, each with a Hall and village green, now they are fused into one village with the Parish Church at the centre. Until electricity and sewage came to the village in 1952, there were few visitors and the people mostly worked on local farms, or for small building firms, shops, blacksmiths and agricultural engineers. The village was self sufficient. Now few work on the land or in the village as the farms are highly mechanised, and the shops have gone.
